net.tomp2p.holep.strategy

Class AbstractHolePStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.tomp2p.holep.strategy.AbstractHolePStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HolePStrategy
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NonPreservingSequentialStrategy, PortPreservingStrategy

    public abstract class AbstractHolePStrategy
extends Object
implements HolePStrategy
    DO NOT INSTANTIATE THIS CLASS!

    If you need to add a new supported nat type please extend this class and change also NATType and NATTypeDetection.

    This class is responsible for the whole hole punching procedure. It covers all aspects of the procedure on the sender and the recipient side.
    Author:
    Jonas Wagner

      • prepareHandlers

        protected List<Map<String,Pair<io.netty.util.concurrent.EventExecutorGroup,io.netty.channel.ChannelHandler>>> prepareHandlers(boolean initiator,
                                                                                                                              FutureDone<Message> futureDone)
        This method does two things. If the initiating peer calls it, he gets back a List of new SimpleInboundHandler to deal with the replies of the replying peer. If a replying peer is calling this method it will return a List of default SimpleInboundHandlers from the Dispatcher.
        Parameters:
        futureResponse -
        Returns:
        handlerList

      • tryConnect

        public void tryConnect()
                throws Exception
        This methods is only called by a HolePScheduler. It simply creates a dummyMessage and sends it from a given localPort ( ChannelFuture) to a given remotePort. This procedure then punches the holes needed by the initiating Peer.
        Specified by:
        tryConnect in interface HolePStrategy
        Throws:
        Exception
